fields.description:
When switching between the Attached and Web Images tabs on the Image Browser, the 'Border' checkbox moves around.

It is also not persisted when switching tabs.

This makes it slightly confusing to use - if I uncheck the box on the Web Images tab, then switch to the Attached Images tab, then it looks at first glance to be still checked. It is only if I stop and read the text that I realise the checkboxes are different on this tab.

I suggest that:
# The 'Border' and 'Thumbnail' tabs are switched around (so that 'Border' is first on both tabs)
# If I check/uncheck border on one tab, then the state should persist when I switch tabs
fields.summary: Border checkbox on image dialog should be in the same position on both tabs

fields.description:
The 'Confluence Drag and Drop Plugin' allows you to remove the 'drop zone' from the 'Attachments' view, but still retain the drag and drop functionality. This is done by disabling this plugin's 'View Attachments Drop Zone' module only.

To remove the equivalent 'drop zone' from the 'Insert Image' dialog box requires the Confluence administrator to disable the 'Image Dialog Client' module. However, doing so not only removes the drop zone, but also the drag and drop functionality from this dialog box too.

Perhaps introduce a module (or modify the existing 'Image Dialog Client' module's behaviour) to only disable the 'drop zone', thereby making its functionality resemble the 'Attachments' view page.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop - The behaviour in disabling of 'drop zones' between the 'Attachments' view and 'Insert Image' dialog box is inconsistent.

fields.description:
When opening a file with the Office Excel viewer or other WebDAV macros, the expected behavior should be that the first user to open the file is given read/write permission while all subsequent users should be notified that the file is locked for editing and can either open it Read-Only or be Notified when the file is ready for editing (unlocked from the first user).

The actual behavior we have seen is that multiple users can open and edit Excel files via the WebDAV plugin and overwrite eachother's changes. Versions are tracked in Confluence however if the first user saves and then the second user saves the file, the first user's changes are not reflected in the second user's saved version.
fields.summary: WebDAV does not lock files and/or notify users when a file is unlocked and free to edit

We are evaluating 3.1-Beta2 EAR/WAR on Solaris / WebSphere / Oracle in the hopes of going PRODUCTION with it once Atlassian officially releases Confluence 3.1 for production use. We have 2 mission critical jQuery based plugins that worked fine on Version 2.7.3 before jQuery 1.2.6 was bundled with Confluence starting with verison 2.8

Anyhow, we are planning to go with 3.1 rather than 3.0.2 because 3.1 uses jQuery 1.3.2, and our jQuery plugins do not work with jQuery 1.2.6.

The plugins have been modified from the originals to use the new Web Resources code in the XML and velocity template files.

#requireResource("confluence.web.resources:jquery")

The plugin in question WORKED FINE in 3.1-Beta1 and WORKS in the 3.1-Beta2 STAND ALONE.

But is NOT working in the latest 3.1-Beta2 EAR/WAR installation. NO JQUERY FILES ARE DOWNLOADING - EVEN THE SYSTEM BASED ONE.

We are anxious to resolve this as soon as possible, as everything else tested against 3.1-Beta2 WORKS GREAT.

Even though this is not production, my management is pushing this project as if "it is", as they would like to cement the decision to go with 3.1 when it is finally released - so any "expedited" assistance on this issue would be most appreciated.
fields.summary: jQuery is not downloading in 3.1-Beta2 EAR/WAR though it works in earlier Beta1 and Beta2 StandAlone

fields.description:
I was fixing my global and space Page layouts to line them up and make sure the custom space Page layout had all the changes from the global layout. I reset the space page layout to default and saved my global layout.

Now when I try to create a new custom page layout on my space or try to view the default it shows this:

    A decorator was requested that does not exist: decorators/page.vmd.

Opening any page on this space now only generates a big stack trace and it is blocking our big rollout of the system.

    java.lang.RuntimeException: Error rendering template for decorator root

My global layouts still work fine and the page.vmd is in the <conf_home>/decorators/ folder.

Edit: Reseting the global page layout to default seems to fix this but trying to make a custom global page layout breaks it again. Seems the issue is with the global page layout, not the space page layout.

Edit1: Seems my actual error is:
    Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.ParseErrorException: Encountered "#if" at /decorators/page.vmd[line 60, column 10]
Was expecting:
    <RPAREN> ...

I'll try to find if this is just my bad coding or related to the global/space layout.

Edit2: You can remove/close this, was caused by my #if being in an old #HTMLSafe().
fields.summary: Can't create a custom space anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17819].
  {panel}

In CONF-17151, it was established that if a page contains more than 32 CSS imports, IE will randomly drop CSS files and/or JavaScript includes, causing random and difficult-to-debug failures.

The implemented fix batched up the CSS imports for the bundled plugins, reducing the number of import statements, but is not a permanent solution to the problem.

We should have a test that asserts that the default number of CSS imports on any given Confluence page is less than a defined number (possibly around 20, which gives buffer room for 3rd-party plugins to include their own). Thus, a few years down the track when we all forget and the number of CSS imports creeps up again, we'll see a test failure before we start seeing random JavaScript errors in IE.

Created as a separate issue from CONF-17151, as writing the automated test is a lower priority task that shouldn't delay the release process.
fields.summary: Create test to assert number of CSS imports on a Confluence page

fields.description:
Upload an xls file with multiple sheets, and use the viewfile macro to display it on a page.

[According to the docs|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/View+File+Macro#ViewFileMacro-excel], if the 'sheet' parameter is not set, then the default behaviour should be to show the first sheet. 

This is not working correctly - see [this page|https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~mhrynczak/Checklist+-+viewfile+for+xls] as an example.  The first viewxls macro should be showing the *first* sheet.
fields.summary: Sheet parameter default behaviour is not working as documented for the viewxls macro

fields.description:
When a gadget loads in the macro browser and has an error, the insert button is grayed out with the message "Please use the save button within the preview area". But there is no save button since there was an error. Was confused by message.

See screenshot.
fields.summary: No gadget save button, but told to use it
Autowire actions with dependencies before parameters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17804].
  {panel}

Please give some examples on:
# How to change fonts in PDF stylesheets
# How to modify headers (eg. title, h1, h2 and so on)
# There is an [existing guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Advanced+PDF+Stylesheet+Customisations] on how to add images in PDF stylesheet, but it isn't clear. It would be perfect if we can have an example which can be used by the customer as a template
fields.summary: Improve PDF Export Stylesheet documentation

fields.description:
After restarting a tomcat, I cannot search the keyword because of the bellow error and cannot show the "Recently Updated" history in the dashboard page
To remove this error ,I always have to restore from the backuped xml data.
Indexing Language setting is "CJK" and a searching keyword is korean.
I'd like to solve this issue. this is a quite big problem in my users

fields.description:
It seems that the fix for CONF-17531 has broken alignment of the drop downs for the new move dialog.


This broke between beta2 and beta3 (there is no version in JAC for beta3 - it was supposed to be for me to test bundled plugins only).
[From a query between the two relevant dates in FishEye|https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/search/confluence/trunk?head=true&comment=&contents=&addedText=&deletedText=&filename=&branch=&tag=&fromdate=2009-11-15T00%3A00%3A00&todate=2009-11-19T23%3A59%3A59&groupby=changeset&col=path&col=revision&col=author&col=date&col=csid&refresh=y] it looks like CONF-17531 is the likely problem.

I might be wrong on the cause but either way a fix would be nice! :-)
fields.summary: autosuggest in move dialog drop down has bad left alignment
Images within section macro render differently between Firefox and Safari

fields.description:
The particular case here is the new (for Confluence 3.1) drag and drop plugin. This is a plugins 2 plugin that cannot be i18n from our current French of German language packs. (These language packs are bundled in the WEB-INF/lib location in our WAR.)

The problem is that the Plugin 2 Action (I18nAction in this case) is being autowired by the ConfluenceAutowireInterceptor and you can see in setI18NBean that the DefaultI18NBean being set does not contain any of the bundles from the language pack. It's a different bean from that which is set on core actions or Plugins 1 actions. The Plugins 2 Action's context does not see this bean.

In addition, adding the translated property file directly to the drag and drop plugin instead of using the language pack doesn't help. The i18n_fr_FR.properties file or i18n_de_DE.properties (or even i18n_fr.properties/i18n_de.properties) does not seem to be read.
fields.summary: Internationalising plugins 2.0 doesn't work from language packs (or in the plugin itself)

fields.description:
Page (name): DwHDV 
Subpages (names) : DwHDVNamenskonventionen, DwHDVBenutzer

Renaming the page *DwHDV* to *DWH 2 Datenversorgung + Datenmodellierung* will also rename the links on the page which start with *DwHDV* (page name)

Example: 
*DwHDVNamenskonventionen* to *DWH 2 Datenversorgung + DatenmodellierungNamenskonventionen*
*DwHDVBenutzer* to *DWH 2 Datenversorgung + DatenmodellierungBenutzer*

So everything will be renamed that matches DwHDV ! The links are now broken.

fields.description:
As an admin user, go to a page which has restricted editing to another user. 

Use the Restrictions dialog to allow the admin user to edit the page, and make edits.

Now suppose the admin user wants to reset the page permissions back to how they were. This is impossible - each time the permissions dialog is edited, the current user is included as one of the users.
fields.summary: Admin user cannot reset permissions on a restricted page after allowing admin-access

fields.description:
As an admin user, go to a page which has restricted editing to another user. Note that the 'Edit' link is not shown.

Please note that as well as the edit link not being shown, the tools menu is empty as well (so you cannot go tools > restrictions, to edit the restrictions).

The page restrictions should be consistent. I.e. if the view is restricted a certain person, then if the admin can see the page, then they should be able to edit it even if the view/edit page restriction exists. 

h4. Workaround 
Open the restrictions dialog, and click 'Me' to allow editing (or remove all existing edit restrictions).
!Page.jpg!

Note that the 'Edit' link is still not shown. The admin user must reload the page to be able to edit it.
fields.summary: Admin user does not see 'Edit' link on a page after changing the restrictions to permit editing

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce. 

# Upgrade from 3.0.2->3.1 on a server running on a context path. For example, http://localhost:8080/confluence
# When navigating to Confluence in your browser, you should get a message saying that you need to upgrade your Confluence license. 
# Click on the link to enter your new license. 

This will take you to a 404 page because the context path is missing. Add the correct context path and it works.

fields.description:
See related issues CONF-17292, CONF-17225, CONF-17124

When an Excel file has been saved with 1000s of empty rows or columns, it may result in an OOM when viewed in Confluence.  It is fairly common to save files in this way, and within Excel there is no difference in behaviour or appearance.

To protect against this error being thrown in Confluence, the "View in Office" link should automatically put a limit on the number of rows/columns that are displayed.
fields.summary: Confluence should not throw an OutOfMemory error when trying to open a large Excel document
search result is not highlighted when using wild cards

fields.description:
When a user is not permitted to attach images to a page/draft, the dropzone appears in the image dialog anyway.

See also CONF-17743 , which points out that anonymous users aren't allowed to upload attachments to drafts.
fields.summary: Image Dropzone appears in image dialog when user is not permitted to add images

fields.description:
Update the default Confluence Dashboard welcome message.  The new message is here https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/MAR/Dashboard+Welcome+Message

Also, the mechanism for generating the message is poor. Currently we have dashboard-welcome.vm using a small set of property values. We have some HTML in the VM file and some in the property values.

We should probably fix this so that the entire message is in property files, including mark up. Also, we could just make the entire value a default value for the site welcome message instead of needing the dashboard-welcome.vm file.
fields.summary: Replace welcome message for 3.1 and improve welcome message mechanism
Image dialog will not launch for a user using non-English language

fields.description:
The 'OAuth Access Tokens' screen wording in Confluence should resemble that of JIRA's.

Reasons:
* Consistency across all Atlassian products
* The terminology is consistent with our documentation
* Once the user reads the documentation, the UI wording will ultimately be less confusing

Please see attached screenshot.

The link in the settings screen should say:

"View OAuth Access Tokens"

Please also try an integrate the wording on the main section of the screen - although replace "JIRA" with "Confluence".
fields.summary: Make wording of 'OAuth Access Tokens' consistent with other Atlassian applications.

fields.description:
The new 'More' feature in Activity Streams shows a black dot to the left of the 'More' 'button'.

See attached screenshot.
fields.summary: New 'More' feature in Activity Streams shows a black dot to the left of the 'More' 'button'.

fields.description:
the xwork lib we use has a bug where in [OgnlUtil|http://svn.opensymphony.com/fisheye/browse/xwork/tags/xwork_1-0-3-1/src/java/com/opensymphony/xwork/util/OgnlUtil.java?r=307] class has not synchronization around accessing shared HashMap inside {{compile}} method. In par It may lead to a infinite loop in map.get() and therefore high cpu and the death of the system. 

This situation happened on eac on 19/11/2009.
fields.summary: Concurrent not synchronized access to hashmap in OgnlUtil class leads to infinite loop and high cpu
Document that Drag and Drop is only for the default theme for now

fields.description:
Please add the ability to [embed AtlassianTV videos|http://www.atlassian.com/tv] into other places such as blogs, Confluence (using the Widget macro), etc.

These videos aren't getting the distribution they deserve.....because they can't be distributed yet :)


http://www.atlassian.com/tv
fields.summary: the ability to embed Atlassian TV videos into other places.

fields.description:
As an example:

* Goto https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=1787625475&originalId=1787625486
* Click on " << Changes from 2 to 3  " https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?originalId=1787625481&pageId=1787625486
* The space becomes "#  Undefined Space"

fields.description: Having the distribution project separate to the main source means after the main source tag there is a lag before the distribution build is performed.  During this lag things change in the distribution project (to match trunk) but are no longer valid for the old main source tag.

fields.description:
When an attachment name contains the ellipsis character '...' the attachment cannot be deleted.
Any attempt to do so results in the error: 'You are not permitted to perform this operation.'

Permissions are fine, and any attachment on the same page without the ellipsis can be deleted without a problem.

The attachment has to be renamed in the database, as attempting to use the Edit link causes a system error: 

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.MoveAttachmentAction.bootstrap(MoveAttachmentAction.java:120)

Have not been able to test in Conf3, but could not find a report of this anywhere, so I'm assuming (despite the inherent risks in that!) that it still exists.
fields.summary: Ellipsis in attachment name causes error
Additional user related remote apis

fields.description:
When checking "Minor Change" while making changes to a page you are able to stop email-alerts from beeing sent.
However, "Minor Change (No not. will be sent)" does not stop the small edit from beeing printed out using the "Recently-updated" or "Recently-updated-dashboard" macro.

Because of people fixing typo's or making consmetic changes our Recently-Updated macro is close to useless as most changes aren't "real" changes.

Changing the "Minor Change" to include hiding from the Recently-updated macro by default doesn't sound like the best solution.
Maybe an option under "General Configuration":  "Make Minor Change hide updates to the recently-updated macro" or maybe a 2nd checkbox?
fields.summary: Make "Minor Change? (No not. will be sent) " hide changes from beeing visible to the "Recently-updated" macro.
Network macro : Content should update automatically after follow/unfollow without needing a page reload

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-17750].

Hello,

sometimes it would be useful to know when a plugin was installed and in case of trouble to rollback to a previous version easily. Confluence could, rather than replace the plugin in the db, add another timestamped entry (as it already does) and let the admin choose which one to activate.

Regards,
Edoardo

fields.description:
On Extranet, where we have page IDs that go above the 32-bit area, drag-n-drop upload of attachments can sometimes attach dropped files to the wrong page.

For example, earlier today I attached some files to the 'Test page' in my personal space, page ID: 69518087748091042. They were uploaded to the 'Security Cards' page in the 'Admin' space, page ID: 69518087748071009.

So the attachments page URLs are:

https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=69518087748091042 -- intended page
https://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpageattachments.action?pageId=69518087748071009 -- actual page

I imagine this is due to incorrect handling of page IDs in the JavaScript code, where we cast the value to a number. Page IDs need to always be treated as strings in JavaScript to avoid this truncation problem.
fields.summary: Drag-n-drop on attachments page adds attachments to wrong page if page ID is very long
